intro: Chamaefilix serrata, commonly known as the serrated rockrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with dark green, scale-like leaves. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and are followed by small, cone-like fruits. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
